etymology.description: Depicts a person bending the lower back -> extended time
etymology.interpretation: The character 久(久) (jiǔ, "long time") visually represents a person leaning forward, symbolizing the passage of a significant amount of time. The bending posture suggests protracted duration.

examples.chinese: 我等待了很久(我等待了很久)。
examples.english: I waited for a long time.

examples.chinese: 分别了很久(分別了很久)，朋友仍然相聚(朋友仍然相聚)。
examples.pinyin: Fēnbié le hěn jiǔ, péngyǒu réngrán xiāngjù.
examples.english: It has been a long time since we parted, yet friends still meet.

examples.chinese: 远行归来已久(遠行歸來已久)，家门依旧温暖(家門依舊溫暖)。
examples.pinyin: Yuǎnxíng guīlái yǐ jiǔ, jiāmén yījiù wēnnuǎn.
examples.english: It has been a long time since returning from a journey, yet the home remains welcoming.
